column4: does anyone have an idea why my synaptic package manager wont open? when i select it (default breezy install) it requests authentication but the synaptic window im used to doesnt come up. nothing appears to happen
sounds like a gdm problem

what doesnt mean a whole lot to me. im fairly new at this (ive sucessfully installed it once on a powerbook, and now this time on a PC). any suggestion as to where to start to figure out how to fix it?
try sudo apt-get install gdm    in the terminal
ran that, authenticated, and it went to the next line. i see no network activity or anyting happening
polpak , i dont even get any error return when i have bad syntax trying to apt-get
i get the password box, just not the package manager
oh ok did you reinstall synaptic?
ive not installed anything at all since my initial setup of this ubuntu system (last night i think it was. maybe two days ago). how would i reinstall it?
i found the site where i could get the debian files, but i mean then what..compile? dont really know how if thats whats next. ahah
don't have to just open up the terminal and type sudo apt-get install synaptic
it says this: cary is not in the sudoers file.  This incident will be reported.
do you have multiple user on your system?
just root and cary ..thats it
sounds like cary doesn't have permmision to make changes
is there a way to make that happen?
are you on the machine right now   is it connected to the internet?
im goign to paste what it said when i ran that install as root
don't know why your running this as root
well it was the only thing i could think of after you said "cary doesnt seem to have permission" or whatever
i ran apt-get update and then i was notifed of the new updates via the gui  but i still cant see my synaptic
